tagDescription: Fred Frey, Union Bank of Louisiana, New Orleans: Asks opinion on standing of Ralli & Co. of Trieste.

No. 344 Maryland - A further supplement to the Act entitled An Act imposing a tax on collateral inheritances, distributive shares and legacies to aid in paying the debts of the State passed at December Session 1844, Ch. 237.
J.H.B. Latrobe to T.W. Ward - Maryland political and financial matters - Press Copy.
Chas. Oakley to Baring Bros. & Co. Indiana affairs - Wabash and Erie Railroad.
A. Gracie to Baring Bros. & Co. Covering Merchants and Planters Prices Current, Mobile.
J.H.B. Latrobe to T.W. Ward - Comments on political matters.
J.H.B. Latrobe to T.W. Ward - Ohio financial affairs.
Arch. Gracie: Cotton.
No. 196 Maryland - An Act for the better collection of the Public Revenue.
Morris Prevost & Co.: Subscription to the United States 6% loan for $50,000.
W.H. Robertson to [T. Baring] congratulating him upon the interest he is taking in the introduction of Indian Corn into their market and offering his assistance.
Herman Sellem, Son & Co.: J.B. Toulmin of Mobile asks for agency of the Royal Mail Steam Packet Co.
Myers & Co.: Corn.
Arch. Gracie: Cotton prices.
Hugh O'Neal to Wm. B. Butler: Trusteeship on behalf of the Wabash and Erie Canal.
Unsigned: Reports the failure of the firm of Mr. Gire in a letter from Messrs. Gardner, Rose & Co. of Palermo.
D. Leavitt: Refers to the business of William L. Helfenstein of Illinois.
Estimate of wheat and flour required - estimate of wheat has been imported into the country since 1828 - giving ports and amounts. Sgd/E . Erickson.
Allen Robbins to Wm. S. Still: Claim against the firm of Thomas Wilson & Co.
W.H. Morse: Trade with China.
J.H.B. Latrobe: Passage of Funding Bill postponed.
Arch. Gracie: Lists directors and stock-holders of a railroad company.

Aug. C. French, Governor of Illinois to Baring Bros. & Co. Refers to copy of letter addressed to him by members of both Legislatures forwarded to them, drawing attention to the manner in which the business of Illinois and Michigan Canal was conducted, and particularly to the salaries paid to the Trustees - and further enlarges on the subject.
Henry Barnewall: Letter of introduction for Wm. Malony of Belfast.
Arch. Gracie: Cotton.
Davis, Brooks & Co.: Railroad steel, prices and market.
Memoranda re Illinois from Captain Swift.
Arch. Gracie: Prospects of cotton crop.
Leslie Alexander & Co.: Statement of Assets and Liabilities.

Augustus C. French, Governor of Illinois, to Baring Bros. & Co. Transmitting Resolutions passed by the several benches of General Assembly re payment of State Debts - Suggesting a plan for European Bondholders to surrender the Internal Improvement Bonds now held by them, on certain named terms
No. 193 Maryland - A Supplement to the Act, imposing duties on promissory notes, bills of exchange, specialties and other instruments of writing, to aid in paying the debts of the State.
Arch. Gracie: Cotton.
T.W. Ward to Baring Bros. & Co. & Magniac, Jardine & Co. Re subscriptions to Illinois Loan - press copies.
J.H.B. Latrobe to T.W. Ward - Concerning difficulties encountered and expenses incurred in the passing of the Resumption Bill.
Wm. Appleton: Refers to the business of Mr. Thorndike.
A. Gordon to Baring Bros. & Co. On the affairs of the Consolidated Association Planters, Louisiana.
Arch. Gracie: Cotton market.
H. Baldwin: Enclosing letters of introduction from Martin Van Buren of 18 June 1847 and Washington Irving of 3 July 1847.

Production of the United States - 1. Estimate of Crops, wheat, barley &c. 2. The products for 1848 of Agriculture, forest, fisheries &c. Statistics of Indigo in the United States. Consumption of cotton.
R.W. Milbank: Conferred with Mr. Purton about purchases.
No. 288 Maryland - A Supplement to the Act entitled "An Act to regulate sales by Public Auction", passed at December Session, 1827, Chap. III.
Count Tejal: Part of letter relating to financial crisis because of insurgents.
T. Woodroffe: Request for letter of introduction for Geo. T. Woodroffe to Baring's Canadian agents.
Memos pertaining to the Maryland loan.
Louis McLane, Baltimore & Ohio Railroad Co.: Agreement to postpone payment for April.
Geo. Summer to J. Bates. Re Boston Water Loan - American politics - European affairs.
G. Miltenberger, Cashier Consolidated Association Planters, Louisiana, to Baring Bros. & Co. Notifying them that the Bank is under the administration of a Board of Managers and Directors &c.
W.H. Swift to Baring Bros. & Co. With respect to Illinois and Michigan Canal Loan.
Venezuela - proposal for a Loan.

No. 141 Maryland - A further supplement to the Act to authorize the licensing of the Stock Brokers Exchange and Bill Brokers and to regulate contracts for the purchase and sale of Loans and Stocks passed at December Session 1841 Chap. 282.
D. Bell: Transaction in American securities.
Edward Prime: Forms new firms with Samuel and John Ward.
T.W. Ward to Magniac, Jardine & Co. & Baring Bros. & Co. Covering correspondence relating to the Illinois Loan and its subscribers.
Memo on purchases of corn with prices.
Boston Committee to Magniac, Jardine & Co. & Baring Bros. & Co. On the subject of the deficiency in the subscription to the Illinois Loan.
W.B. Ogden to W.H. Swift - Illinois and Michigan Canal Trustees legislation in connection with the Canal. Filed with 18 February 1847.
Arch. Gracie: Complains of high prices of cotton.
Joshua Bates to T. Baring - comments on the Oregon trouble - and trade matters.
H.P. Sturgis: Credit for Russell & Co., Mexican affairs.
George Bancroft: Attitude of the Secretary of the Treasury in contractual obligations.
Theodore Dehon to J. Bates. Re New York & Erie Railroad. Encloses recommendation by the Board of Directors of the Company.
J.H.B. Latrobe to J. Johnson, Annapolis: Funding of 3% stock.
R.B. Forbes: Sends model of Clipper ship Samuel Russell.
T.W. Ward to Baring Bros. & Co. & Magniac, Jardine & Co. Illinois Canal Matters.
F.H. Elmore, Bank of the State of South Carolina, Charleston, S.C.
P. Perit: Inquires about changes in consequences of the death of Mr. Goodhue.
No. 71 Maryland - An Act to provide for the speedy collection of the public revenue.
J.H.B. Latrobe to T.W. Ward - Interviews with Mr. Webster - Comments on relations with Britain.
Sam J. Peters, City Bank. Louisiana bonds.
W.H. Swift to T.W. Ward - Illinois matters.
An Act to authorize the refunding of the State Debt, passed by the Legislature of Illinois at their last Session.
Fred Frey, Union Bank: Unsettled situation in Europe makes difficult to consign goods.

No. 175 Maryland - A further additional Supplement to the Act entitled An Act for the general valuation and assessment of property in this State and to provide a tax to pay the debts of the State passed at March Session 1841, Ch. 23.
Baltimore & Ohio Railroad Co. Act of March 1846 authorizing the Company to issue Bonds and sell them at such prices as they may please - &c.
W.H. Swift to T.W. Ward - Information in relation to the Illinois and Michigan Canal.
Exports of Sacks of Corn from New Orleans to British ports.
R.B. Forbes: Shipping relief for Ireland.
Arch. Gracie: Prices for cotton remain high.
A.C. French, Governor of Illinois: State debt.
No. 354 Maryland - An Act to facilitate the collection of taxes in the City of Baltimore from Banks and other incorporated institutions, and for other purposes.
Louis McLane, President Baltimore & Ohio Railroad Co., to Baring Bros. & Co. Affairs of Maryland and the Baltimore and Ohio Railroad.
Illinois and Michigan Canal Subscriptions-Interest Account - Subscribers' names and amounts.
Unsigned memo relating to American whalers.
Arch. Gracie: Refers to competition with Forstall in purchases of cotton. Also another letter on same subject of same date.
A. Lanfear: Obtained credit for 12,000 pounds.
Arch. Gracie to J. Bates. Covering circular - Statement of the Cotton Markets.
E. Barnwell: Advance on cotton.
Charles A. Jacobs: Letter of introduction for Sam. J. Peters, City Bank of New Orleans.
Copy of Memoranda sent to Governor Davis appertaining to Trust Deed when drawn - (Illinois & Michigan Canal Co. Loan).
Unsigned: Expects early peace with Mexico. Financial matters.
Sam.J. Peters, City Bank: Purchase of State bonds.
Louis McLane, Baltimore and Ohio Railroad Co.: Raising money for work on the Ohio River.
J.M. Forbes to J. Bates. Wishing to know what prospect there is for the Chesapeake & Ohio Canal Loan being taken up.
Arch. Gracie: Good prospects for cotton crop.
Jose Safont, Madrid to the Directors of the Union Bank: Tobacco market, prices and quality.
Charles E. Trevelyan, Treasury: Comments favourably on businesslike conduct of their American agents.
J.R. Brodhead: Introduction for George N. Sanders of New York.
Theodore Dehon: New York & Erie Railway Co.
Chas. Oakley: Wabash and Erie Canal.
A.&S. Henry & Co.: Shipments of dry goods from Liverpool to the United States.

New York Committee to W.H. Swift & D. Leavitt: Complaining of their ignoring the grievances of the Bondholders - their neglect of duty and their excessive compensation. N.B. The members of the New York Committee are: T. Tileston, E. Riggs, Jacob Little, Silas Wood.
Horace Gray, Jr.: Postponed departure to execute instructions.
C.E. Trevelyan, Treasury: Food for relief of Ireland.
Illinois & Michigan Canal Loan.
F.P. Corbin: Henry Ellis is anxious to consult them about securities.
R.B. Forbes to J. Bates - Re speculation in opium in connection with Samuel Cabot and Thomas H. Perkins Jr.
Settlement with Mr. Leavitt and his engagement to most 1/3 of the deficiency arising from Mr. Hersley Palmers diminished subscription. (Illinois and Michigan Canal Loan).
A.&S. Henry & Co.: Shipments of cotton, linen, woollen and worsted fabrics from Liverpool to the United States.
Unsigned memo from Anvers: List of creditors.
Fred Frey: Union Bank of Louisiana: Refers to the arrangement with Messrs. James Robb & Co.
Fred Frey, Union Bank of Louisiana: Complains of lack of confidence in banks.
John G. Whitehorne: Request for charity
_______ to D. Webster - Comments on the financial and commercial depression in the country, attributing the greater part of it to the Mexican War.
T.J. Quarles to Wm. B. Butler: Trusteeship of the Wabash and Erie Canal.
T.W. Ward to Baring Bros. & Co. and Magniac, Jardine & Co. Illinois affairs.
Southern Railroad Co.: Report of committee of the citizens of Vicksburg.

Rothschild & Co. to Baring Bros. & Co. Informs them that necessary arrangements are being made for affecting the delivery of the securities belonging to the United States Bank Loan for 900,000 pounds to holders in exchange for their debentures.
Hon. J. Davis to Baring Bros. & Co. Illinois financial affairs.

D. Leavitt, Treasurer Illinois and Michigan Canal Co., to W.H. Swift. Report on money received on account of the subscription to the Loan of 1,600,000 pounds to complete the Illinois & Michigan Canal. Enclosed letters: 1/12/1845, 26/11/1845, 27/11/1845, 31/12/1845.
J.L. Clark: Asks to refer letters to Erastus Corning.
G.B. Dixwell: Trade with China: opium, silk.
Brown, Shipley & Co.: Introduction for James Hunter who represents the Maryland Mining Co.
Fred Frey, Union Bank of Louisiana,: securities.

J.H.B. Latrobe to J. Bates - Re contemplated application of the Baltimore & Ohio Railroad Co. for the extension of the period of payment of the last installment of their debt to them, from October 1848 to October 1849 - Details of present prospects of the Railroad.
Enoch Train: Reports sale of ship Joshua Bates.
John D. Bates: Asks for character reference of Messrs. Cater, Collet & Co.
List of Bills referred to Messrs. Baring Brothers.
G.T. Smith: Declines to sell Louisiana bonds.
M. Field Fowler: Offers to market quicksilver.
P. Perit to J. Bates. Re death of Mr. Goodhue and consequent rearrangement of the firm.
Arch. Gracie: Cotton.

C.E. Trevelyan (Treasury) to Baring Bros. & Co. Transmitting Copy of a Minute of the Treasury Board, dated 30 June 1846, acknowledging public service rendered by them in the case of those suffering from scarcity in Ireland.

Chas. Oakley to Baring Bros. & Co. and Magniac, Jardine & Co. Criticism of the administration of Illinois and Michigan Canal affairs generally, and especially the appointment by authority of the President and Treasurer only, of Wm. Gooding, lately discharged Ch. Engineer to the office of Secretary of the Company. Also letter from David Leavitt of 1 November 1848 and Resolution of Trustees of 31 October 1848.
R.B. Forbes to Wm. Rathbone: Relief for Scotland and Ireland.
Daniel Webster to Baring Bros. & Co. Respecting the contract of the Chesapeake and Ohio Canal Co. Maryland finances generally.
Fred Frey, Union Bank of Louisiana; New Orleans: Louisiana State bonds; cotton.
G.L. Rogers to Hottinguer & Co., Havre; Consignment of the ship Taglioni.
Hon. John Davis to T. Baring M.P. Illinois affairs - Makes an interesting comment on the Oregon Question.
Maurras: Business matters.
P. Perit: $75,000 of new capital brought into the firm by the sons of Goodhue.
H.P. Sturgis: Miss Diana Howard leaves Calcutta for England.
Birckhead & Pearce: Letter of reference for James B. Bond.
J.J. Atkinson, Baltimore and Ohio Railroad: Statement of revenue for 1845 and 1846. Also extract from the Charter.
D. Leavitt to T.W. Ward: Wabash and Erie Canal.
J.B. Toulmin: Request for agency of the Royal Mail Steam Packet Co.
No. 166 Maryland. A Supplement to the Act imposing a tax on commissions allowed to trustees and receivers to aid in paying the debt of the State, passed at December Session 1841, Chap. 181.
Horace Gray: Concerning the Arroyo Estate on Cuba Island.
Silas Wood to T.W. Ward - Discusses fully the affairs with regard to the Trustees of Illinois & Michigan Canal. Press copy.
Arch. Gracie: Introducing Sam. G. Fisher of Mobile and referring to the coast survey of the Bay of Mobile.
Fred Frey, Union Bank of Louisiana: Payment on bonds and interest.

No. 306 Maryland - An Act to confirm an Act entitled "An Act to alter and amend the constitution and form of Government of the State of Maryland, so as to substitute biennial for annual Sessions of the Legislature and for other purposes", passed at December Session 1849, Ch. 269.
L. Mark, United States Consul: Short crop of grain in Germany. Suggests shipments of American flour.

W.H. Swift to Baring Bros. & Co. Enclosing a private letter to them and Magniac, Jardine & Co. of 22 October 1845 re charges of mismanagement made against the Trustees of the Illinois & Michigan Canal Co.
Benjamin Balch: Will lobby for the National Free Banking Bill before Congress. Creation of uniform currency.
Wm. B. Butler to Charles Oakley: Acknowledges his obligation and discusses Indiana politics.
W.H. Swift: Illinois matters.
Wm. Austin: Cotton crop.
R.B. Forbes: Opium market.
E. Stainer: Affairs of Messrs. H. Castellain Sons & Co.
W.H. Swift to T.W. Ward. On Illinois & Michigan Canal affairs.
Joshua Bates: Refers to Sir Robert Peel's plans; Oregon question.
Henry Goulburn to Thomas Baring, M.P. Instructions for procuring supplies of Indian Corn to be delivered at Cork.
Louis McLane: Asks for a loan for the Baltimore & Ohio Railroad.
H.P. Sturgis: Transfer of credit to Russell & Co.
Whale Fishery - Statistics - vessels - Sperm Oil, Whale Oil and Bone &c.
Arch. Gracie: Cotton market.
J.M. Forbes to J. Bates - Affairs of the Michigan Central Railroad - List of prominent bondholders and of the Directors follows.
No. 253 Maryland - A Supplement to the Act entitled "An Act taxing certain officers" passed at December Session 1844, Ch. 302.
H.P. Sturgis: Relating to cargo of goods from Manila.
G.T. Smith: Declines to sell Louisiana stock.

John H.B. Latrobe to Thomas Baring - Suggesting that arrangements be made by which the coal trade may be controlled by the Chesapeake and Ohio Canal and the flour &c. trade by Baltimore & Ohio Railroad in order to obviate a contest between the two companies - &c.
Lee & Higginson: American securities.
Extract of subscription received from T.W. Ward relating to the Wabash and Erie Canal.
J.W. Winterfield: Reports success in lawsuit against Davis Brooks & Co.
Rich. Thornton: Offers $100,000 for portion of the United States 6% debentures.

W.H. Swift to T.W. Ward Re List of subscriptions Europeans and Americans to the Loan of 1,600,000 pounds for the completion of Illinois & Michigan Canal - See also 27 May 1846 which contains the List.
T.W. Ward to Baring Bros. & Co. & Magniac, Jardine & Co. Forwarding copy of letter from Mr. Lord respecting the Illinois debentures or certificates.
Memoranda re Maryland - Geographical position - results of geographical position - debt of the Chesapeake & Ohio Canal & Baltimore & Ohio Railroad Co. &c. Resources of the State.
W.H. Swift to Baring Bros. & Co. Detailed description of the progress of work on the Illinois & Michigan Canal as also the financial position.
Christopher Hughes: Anxiety about the fate of steamer Hibernia and the French steamer Union.
A. Gracie to J. Bates - Pensacola Railroad Co. (For names of Directors See 23 March 1846). The Cotton Crop - covering circular Merchants and Planters Prices Current.
No. 349 Maryland - An Act entitled An Act for the more prompt and economical collection of the State and County Taxes in the County of Baltimore.
Arch. Gracie: Cotton.
John S. Gittings to Baring Bros. & Co. Maryland's financial standing.
A.&S. Henry & Co. Manchester - Shipments of woven fabrics from Liverpool to the United States.
Count Tejal: End of Civil War near. Urges financial investment.
No. 357 Maryland. An Act relating to Foreign corporations and their agencies in this State.
F.H. Delano to J. Bates covering a copy of a Pamphlet of Albert Gallatin on the Oregon Question (missing).
Charles Butler: Indiana bonds.
J.H.B. Latrobe to T.W. Ward: Extract of letter refering to payments under tax laws.
Daniel Price: Asks for commission for his firm in Mexico to handle the United States indemnity.
Wm. Appleton: Refers to Mr. Thorndike's business.
Interest due on the Illinois and Michigan Canal Loan of $1,600,000.
C.E. Trevelyan to T. Baring M.P. Instructions re conveyance of Indian Corn.
George Morey: Construction of branch railroad from Walpole to join the Boston and Providence Railroad.
A. Guillemin: Tariff bill passed the House.

No. 203 Maryland - A further additional Supplement to the Act entitled an Act for the general valuation and assessment of property in this State and to provide a tax to pay the debts of the State, passed at March Session 1841, Chap.23.
R.B. Forbes: Warship Jamestown put at his disposal.
Thomas Ford to Thomas Willard, Boston: Canal bonds.
Petty Vaughan: Estate of W.N. Boylston. See also 23 January 1849.
Geo .W. Attwood to Baring Bros. & Co. The marketing of American Indian Corn.
No. 238 Maryland - An Act entitled An Act relating to the public debt of Maryland.

No. 216 Maryland - A Supplement to the Act to regulate the issuing of licenses to traders, keepers of ordinaries and others, passed at December Session 1827, Chap. 117, and imposing a tax on brokers for the sale of merchandize.
No. 391 Maryland - A Supplement to the Act imposing tax on Commissions allowed to executers and administrators passed at December Session 1844, Chap. 184.
W.H. Swift and D. Leavitt to Thomas Tilson et al.: Grievances of bondholders.
A. Morphy, President Consolidated Association &c. Re affairs of that Institution.
Translation of Mexican Cabinet decision to pay $2,500,000 to bondholders of foreign debt according to provisions of the Treaty of Guadalupe Hidalgo.
H. Gray: Tea, corn, flour, cotton and other commodities.
Petty Vaughan to Nathaniel Curtis. Boston: Estate of W.N. Boylston. See also 23 January 1849.
Arch. Gracie: Cotton market.
Arnstein & Eskeles: Introduction for N. Benachi who goes to New Orleans.
Fred Frey: Transactions in Louisiana securities.
Abstract of letter from Col. Oakley: State convention to consider finances in relation to the canal.

R.B. Forbes to J. Bates - Re arrangements for reception of the Ship of War, Jamestown, placed at his disposal for carrying contributions from the citizens of Boston and vicinity for the relief of Ireland. Also newspaper extract: Relief for Ireland and Scotland.
John H. Hicks: Refers to Mexican peace.
A.&S. Henry & Co.: Shipments of woven fabrics from Liverpool to United States.
Unsigned: Sales of rice; railroad steel. Prices of copper, hemp, indigo, coffee, sugar and other commodities.
J. Hamilton: Offers cotton for sale. Encloses letter from Legard & O'Hear of 10 September 1846 on the subject.
Memo: Character reference on A. Heard, Geo. B. Dixwell and J. Heard, all of A. Heard & Co.
W.H. Swift, Washington to T.W. Ward: Chesapeake & Ohio Canal Co.
J.J. Dixwell: George B. Dixwell to establish a branch of A. Heard & Co. in Shanghai.
Baring Brothers to T.W. Ward: Subscription for Illinois bonds.
Papers re Comstock Clinton's case (Forgery Jacob Little & Co. See papers under that title).
A. Morphy, Consolidated Association of the Planters of Louisiana: Interest on bonds.
Nathan Hale to T.W. Ward: Comments on enclosed letter from Dr. Hammon (missing).
R.W. Weston: Cotton market, prices.

No. 319 Maryland - A further Supplement to the Act for the general valuation and assessment of property in this State, and to provide a tax to pay the debts of the State, passed at March Session 1841, Chap. 23.
James B. Bond: Ask for letter of credit for James Birckhead. Also another letter of same date.
Bondholders of the State of Louisiana to the President and Directors of the Planters of Louisiana: Payment of interest and principal.
Petty Vaughan: Estate of W.N. Boylston. Also reply from J. Bates of 8 December 1848.
Fred Frey, Union Bank: Municipal bonds and Louisiana bank stock. Encloses list of English commercial firms.
Lord Ashburton: Anxious about corn business involving Prime, Ward & King, and Gurney.
No. 167 Maryland - A Supplement to the Act relating to foreign corporations and their agencies in the State, passed at December Session, 1839, Chap. 24.
J.M. Coale, President: Contract for the completion of the Chesapeake and Ohio Canal to Cumberland.
T.W. Ward to W.H. Swift: Credit of Maryland. Efforts to complete the canal.
Sam. J. Peters, President City Bank to Baring Bros. & Co. Desiring to procure their agency in relation to some business matters in London, on account of said Bank - details of business follow.
J.S. Hughes, New Orleans: Leaves the firm of M.S. Brown and asks for credit.
No. 170 Maryland. A further Supplement to the Act to facilitate the collection of a portion of the tax levied in pursuance of the Act passed at March Session, 1841, Chap. 23.
Louis McLane to J. Bates - Re a loan for the Baltimore & Ohio Railroad.
A. Morphy, Consolidated Association of the Planters of Louisiana; Payment of interest on bonds of 1843.
E. Herseley Palmer: Expects scarcity of bill under American credits.
W.H. Swift: Illinois and Michigan Canal Co.
John H.B. Latrobe to T.W. Ward. Results of the Election and probable legislation with regard to financial matters of Ohio.
Thomas Swann, President Baltimore & Ohio Railroad to Baring Bros. & Co.: Comments upon the strong financial position of the Road and its future prospects.
John H.B. Latrobe to Baring Bros. & Co. The plans suggested by General Cunningham for the management of the financial affairs of the Baltimore & Ohio Canal.
James Hunter to Baring Bros. & Co. On the subject of the Chesapeake and Ohio Canal and a proposed loan of $1,100,000.
Thos. A. Dexter: Agency for Joseph Blunt for "Baker's Improved Steam Boiler Furnace".
A. Gracie to J. Bates - Enclosing circular signed Wright & Lewin with Statement of the Cotton Market. Comments on the Oregon Question.
T.W. Ward to Baring Bros. & Co. & Magniac, Jardine & Co. Covering correspondence on Illinois matters from W.H. Swift 24 February 1846.
J.E. Sheffield: Death of Judge Hitchcock of the New York and New Haven Railroad.
Sam. J. Peters, City Bank: Encloses letter from Fred Frey to James Robb with a resolution authorizing transfer of 2,308 shares of stock of the Bank of Louisiana.
R.B. Forbes: Claims Russell & Co. violated their credit restriction.
List of parties who took up $600,000 of the $1,500,000 Ohio loan.

No. 202 Maryland - A Supplement to an Act passed at December Session, 1844, Chap. 237, entitled "An Act imposing a Tax on collateral Inheritances, Distributive Shares and Legacies, to aid in paying the debts of the State.
W.H. Swift to T.W. Ward: Illinois affairs.
Walter Sherman: Arrangement for credit account.
A.F. Miller: Solicits business for Messrs. Miller and Hoffman.
Daniel Lord to Baring Bros. & Co. Re changes in the firm of Howland and Aspinwall.
Francis Martin: Refers to statement of shipments. Encloses letter from Wood Gibson of 19 January 1848.
Snydam, Sage & Co.: Wheat and flour business.
W.H. Swift to T.W. Ward - Illinois matters. Also letter from Silas Wood of 9 June 1847. See also 17 June 1847. Press copies.
J.J. Dixwell: Asks for better terms of credit for Messrs. A. Heard & Co.

W.H. Swift to Magniac, Jardine & Co. Re List of Bills of Exchange drawn on them by the Trustees of the Illinois & Michigan Canal - Has investigated and promises report on charges preferred against Wm. Gooding, Chief Engineer.
Myer Myers: Asks for Lloyds Agency.
R.B. Forbes: Sam. Cabot, Thos. H. Perkins and himself interested in opium speculation.
Arch. Gracie: Favourable prospects for cotton crop. Also second letter of same date.
J.G. Marshall: Suggests Wm. B. Butler as trustee of the Wabash and Erie Canal.
Arch. Gracie: Cotton.
Arch. Gracie: Prospects of cotton crop.

T.W. Ward to Abbott Lawrence - Comments on certain matters mentioned in a recent conversation - the Banks - the credit of the Government - what the Secretary should do - effect on the country and trade - Mexican War &c.
R.B. Forbes: Forwards model of clipper ship including dimensions.
Arch. Gracie: Prospects of cotton crop.
Hicks & Co.: Discusses economics affairs; depressed prices of cotton.
M. King to Baring Bros. & Co. On the subject of the debt of Mr. Chas. Baring.

T.W. Ward to Baring Bros. & Co. and Magniac, Jardine & Co. Enclosing copy of Mr. Leavitt's letter relating to the proportion of subscriptions and the reply - also a statement of the deficiency according to the actual powers received.
Abbott Lawrence to J. Bates. Introducing Mr. Peter A. Porter.
Sidney Brooks: Dispute about spikes shipped to Pensacola. Also letters of 27 March 1846, 28 July 1846, 15 August 1846.
Thomas Ford, Governor of Illinois to W.H. Swift, also copy of letter to Baring Bros.: Mode of issuance of stock certificates.
No. 366 Maryland - An Act for taxing policies of Insurance.
Daniel Lord: Illinois stock Certificates.

G.R. Robinson, Ch. of the Committee of Spanish American Bondholders, to Messrs. Manning & Mackintosh, Mexico - Instructing them to make immediate application to the Mexican Government for the payment of the arrears of the dividend &c. Press Copy.
Copies of Resolutions of the Legislature of Maryland re coupons of the State of Maryland received by Baring Bros. & Co. &c.
Henry Coleman: Refers to the revolution in Paris.
A.C. French, Governor of Illinois: Encloses letter signed by the members of the General Assembly on the subject of state debt.
Grant & Stone to Edward Burmester: Business reference to Jacob Snyder, Jr., and Geo. Zantzinger.
Arch. Gracie: Cotton crop not too promising.
H.A. Stone: Asks for 10,000 pounds credit.
John H. Hicks: Warehousing Bill.
C.H. Fisher to George Combe, Edinburgh: Competition between the canal and the railroad.
Corn Contracts for Ireland.
John Griswold: Part of Consignments to be placed under John Pickersgill.
Wm. McCure & Co.: Asks for support of the application of Thomas McClure to the post of the American Consul in Belfast.
Christopher Hughes to J. Bates - Maryland Debt - The Oregon affair.

No. 374 Maryland - A Supplement to an Act, entitled An Act to impose a tax upon and to license Theatrical and other public exhibitions and for other purposes, passed at December Session 1841, Chap. 194.

Elihu Chauncey to Baring Bros. & Co. In reply to a request of theirs concerning Philadelphia, Wilmington and Baltimore Railroad Co. Pennsylvania financial affairs. Enclosed letter from M.B. Buckley of 29 September 1845.
Arch. Gracie: Expects short crop of cotton.
Robert Bell: Will transmit letter.
A. Guillemin: Havana Railroad Co. will not suffer from failure of Messrs. Harman & Co. Sugar trade.
No. 92 Maryland - An Act imposing a tax upon the sale of Lottery Tickets to aid in paying the debts of the State.

A. Morphy, Presidential of the Consolidated Association of the Planters of Louisiana to Baring Bros. & Co. Certain propositions for the extension of the outstanding bonds issued in favour of this Bank.
Robert Bell, Agent New Orleans Canal and Banking Co., to Baring Bros. & Co. Asking them to state upon what terms and the amount of credit they would be willing to give the Bank.
George Peabody: Encloses letter from C.C. Tiffany (missing) about returns from private fund.
